title: Shuwa with Fragrant Rice
steps: Crush garlic and sea salt together using pestle and mortar into a smooth paste.
Blend in all dry spices, half of the lemon juice (15g), and half of the olive oil (50ml) until evenly combined.
Rub spice paste thoroughly over lamb. Cover and marinate overnight in refrigerator.
Preheat oven to 140°C (285°F). Remove lamb to reach room temperature.
Wrap lamb leg in banana leaves, seams facing down. Place in deep baking tray.
Cover with foil and bake 1-2 hours until tender with slight pink center.
Rest lamb covered for 30 minutes while cooking rice.
Soak saffron threads in 60ml warm water.
Sauté diced onion in remaining olive oil (80ml) until translucent.
Brown broken vermicelli pieces in the oil.
Add rice and coat with oil. Mix in soaked saffron, cinnamon, allspice, and ginger.
Add stock and bring to boil. Cover with lid and cook on low heat 20 minutes until liquid evaporates.
Fluff rice with fork and add remaining lemon juice (15g).
Carve rested lamb into slices and serve with rice.
notes: Volume conversions: ½ garlic bulb ≈ 25g, ½ tsp salt ≈ 3g, ½ nutmeg grated ≈ 2g, ½ tbsp spices ≈ 8g each, ¼ tbsp turmeric ≈ 4g, juice of ½ lemon ≈ 30g total, 50ml oil ≈ 50g, 80ml oil ≈ 80g
Can substitute aluminum foil for banana leaves if unavailable
